intro: Dicranolepis soyauxii, commonly known as the Soyaux's rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of its leaves, a common feature among ferns. Dicranolepis soyauxii is primarily distributed in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia.
